column1: 1$Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person$6/23/2018 5:08:10 PM$Reviewer: Kaylawit11
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have lost a total of 40 lbs in 4 months. It isnt a magic pill
column3: it still takes diet and exercise to lose weight but Evekeo suppresses your appetite substantially and gives you energy boosts which make the diet and exercise much easier to achieve. It has worked wonders for me. The only negative is sometimes it can make my heart beat very quickly however my blood pressure still seems to be under control.

column1: 4$Condition: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day$4/3/2017 1:06:46 PM$Reviewer: Spark Plug
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Like most this is the third med I have taken for Narcolepsy. The side affects of Adderall and Vyvanse were awful. I have not had any side affects with this. I have been taking it for two months and did not think it was working until I ran out and went without taking it over the weekend. All I could do was sleep. The DR upped by dose to 10mg
column3: which I haven't started yet (waiting on the prior approval from insurance.) I'm hoping that it will work as good or better as the 5 mg did or as well as the Adderall without the side affects. I am hoping my body does not become used to taking the Evekeo because I do not want to have to keep upping the dosage.

column1: 5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/17/2016 5:40:12 PM$Reviewer: Ian
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$After trying Vyvanse and Adderall my doctor recommended this newer drug. In short
column3: this is the drug for me. Helps me focus without the side effects of the others. I suppose everyone reacts different. Just glad I found this one.

column1: 6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/12/2016 7:53:56 PM$Reviewer: Robinhoodaz

column1: 7$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/23/2016 9:19:12 AM$Reviewer: aTroutDude
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am extremely happy with Evekeo. There are no roller coaster ups and downs that I had with Adderall
column3: a much smoother transition. The results/effect seem to last longer without the hyper-focus of Adderall.

column1: I was on Adderall and my VA doctor took me off it completely and said I didn't need it. I was getting in trouble at work for lack of attention to detail
column2: forgetting to pay bills
column3: etc. I went to another doctor
column4: she suggested I try Evekeo. The pharmacy through a communication error and had me on just one 10mg pill a day instead of three
column5: for 3 weeks. I had a follow up was put on three 10mg pills a day(2 @ 8a
column7: and allowed to play around with times taken and could go up to 4 a day. It was a completely experience from Adderall or the 10 mg Evekeo. Adderall was more like a light switch being flipped on then off as the medication wore off. Evekeo was a lot smoother
column8: I never really feel it kick in or turn off
column9: it is just kind of there. It is more like being more effective
column10: less effective. Even when the medication should have worn off
column11: I don't feel as scattered or spacey. With Adderall I would often get these episodes of hyper-focus where I had a hard time switching tasks. So far with Evekeo I have never had those episodes. I work retail
column12: and I am constantly changing focus from customers to task and back. I currently take three 10mg a day but the doctor wrote the script for 105. On longer days where I am up at 7a have to be to work at 1p and work until 9p. If I have taken one pill around 1 or 2p I can feel myself becoming less focused around 6-7p. If I take 2 around 1-2p it will last until around 8:30-9p
column13: which is perfect. I also found that I can't take it later than 3p
column14: I can't get to sleep before midnight-1a. Taking the last pill no later than 1:30p
column15: I can get to sleep by 11p."

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/8/2015 7:53:08 PM$Reviewer: Jeff
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$4$Failed 4 different add meds. By far the best. Just wish they had higher strengths. I take it 15mg 2 times daily and even though the tablets are easy to break.. It's annoying. I feel the best on this one though for sure. No side effects and takes care of my add.

column1: 9$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/7/2015 12:54:46 AM$Reviewer: Spektur
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$3$"The physical side effects outweigh any of the mental benefits
column3: which pale in comparison to Dexedrine. Where do I begin
column6: and feel just plain weird. I know what amphetamines should feel like
column7: when I heard 50% levo I pretty much knew what to expect but figured what the heck

column1: After having been on Dexedrine and adderall for the past 3 years
column2: and now Evekeo. I can fairly say that the levo side of amphetamines is not only inferior it also has far more side effects. This is somewhat of a known fact in the medical community. Amphetamines are either dexdro or levo or some of both. Dexdro tends to be more cerebral and calming while levo tends to be more physical and distruptive
column3: by distruptive I mean your heart will let you know pretty quickly.

column1: Dexedrine is 100% of the dexdro side of amphetamines
column2: Adderall is 75/25
column3: and Evekeo is 50/50. I know that everyone's treatment is personal
column4: so I'll speak for myself as only I can. Dexedrine is by far the superior product
column5: Adderall comes in second because it only has 25% levo.

column1: Evekeo lags behind with its whopping 50% of levo induced jitters
column2: palpitations and tweakiness. When my doc told my they have something new thats 50/50
column3: I was like
column5: yah thats not new. Kinda like when he tried to tout zenzedi as the new cool kid on the block
column6: I was like you mean rebranded dexadrine. I'll take my generic thanks.  I had my doubts about evekeo but wanted to give it a fair shot. Having had dexedrine before I know that there's way better treatment out there. "

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/5/2015 11:16:11 PM$Reviewer: Moke
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$3$"After being on Adderall
column3: Vyvanse and Dexedrine Spansule
column4: I'd say Eveko is a highly effective dextro/levo amphetamine based drug. Unlike adderall
column5: this medication is very mild compared to adderall and the feeling of being wired. This medication lasts longer and more steady than adderall XR and the peak is much longer than Adderall IR. Compared to Vyvanse
column6: this medication has more of a steady in my system mildly vs Vyvanse being strong then wears off fast throughout the course of 12 hours.

column1: I wish they made this medication in higher doses than 5 and 10mg. It's the same thing as adderall except adderall is 75% Dextroamphetamine and 25% Levoamphetamine. This medication is freebase amphetamine sulfate so it's 50% Dextro/Levo. So a 10mg isn't much different than taking a 10mg adderall. It just releases it differently and freebase form is probably more potent than the salts. "

11$Condition: Other$10/11/2015 6:02:29 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I started Evekeo only because of the 60 day free trial -- money can be tight at times and this seemed like a sensible option. I had previously been taking Adderall XR 15mg for my Attention Deficit Disorder (no hyperactivity).
Please use caution with this medication. As soon as I started taking Evekeo I became suicidal
column2: apathetic
column3: very irritable
column4: and it really did not seem to do much for my ADD. My sister said I turned into a completely different person.

column1: I am sure it works wonderfully for others but it took me by surprise! This was the first kind of serious reaction I had to ADD medication -- so your first day or two trying Evekeo make sure you have loved ones around to keep an eye on you."

column1: 14$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/3/2015 8:57:59 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$First time on ADHD medication and i believe i am benefiting from it. column1: Evekeo for me was great because it was 60 pills for free.  I take it as needed

column1: To me

column3: getting thigs done
column4: but I can sleep and I have no irritability.  knowing so many friends on these types of meds

column1:
16$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/24/2015 2:25:52 PM$Reviewer: Matt0990, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$5$5$This product works great!!! I've tried so many other meds and they either don't work or I feel awful on them. It works quickly and lasts about 7 hours for me. I've been on it for two weeks and haven't had any side effects really. I also received a free trial and I did not have to pay anything for a 60 tablet supply. My doc also gave me a copay card to use after that will really keep the cost down. Safe to say I'll be sticking with Evekeo!
17$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/20/2015 12:32:08 AM$Reviewer: Blair89, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I honestly felt like Evekeo made me space out like crazy for the entire day. I am on week 3, and I haven't gotten much done in that period. Much like I was prior to being diagnosed with ADHD. Not to mention my irritability levels have been off the charts, and I've slept more than I ever have since starting the medication. I have my review apportionment tomorrow, and I'm going to request to be put back on Vyvanse. I'd rather deal with the evening crash than put up with this stagnant depressing feel...
18$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/19/2015 1:00:27 PM$Reviewer: ADHD21, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$2$I've been on Vyvanse for about 5 years now and could feel the effectiveness falling a little short each day. I switched over to Evekeo two months ago instead of upping my Vyvanse from 60mg to 70mg. It's effective in that it works in helping to maintain focus and it takes effect quickly. My primary problem is the mood it puts me in. I'm finding myself constantly irritable, stressed, and ready to lash out over, retrospectively, small annoyances. This is especially problematic on days where I leave my afternoon pill (it's a twice a day medication) at home. Two days ago, I was very surprised to find myself in a good mood with a generally positive outlook. Then I realized that I had not forgotten to take Evekeo that day. I'm dropping Evekeo with my next prescription and going back to Vyvanse. That being said, your experience might be different. There's a free month discount available, so it might be worth trying, but know that you might have to do some legwork to locate a pharmacy that carries it. 
19$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/17/2015 1:15:01 PM$Reviewer: SBSUZ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$Ive been taking ADHD meds since professionally diagnosed in 1996 and have taken Adderall XR
column2: Dexadrine (both Shire and generic)
column3: and many different generic Amph Salts including Teva (yuk!) Barr (yuk)...and the most effectve 4 me: Sanzoz/EOS. Ive also tried Corpharma - I use a pretty low dose 10mg 2x's day which really helps me to focus and sit still at work and finish projects.

column1: My doctor recently gave me a free trial of EVEKEO (10's) and I stopped taking it as it seems to MAKE MY BRAIN MORE SCRAMBLED! I also feel ""locked-up"" (even on 10's) & dont feel relaxed and able to speak normally (or speak up in Corp meetings - whcih isnt good!) Its really weird...DONT LIKE IT AT ALL. Also
column2: I noticed it gave me headaches. (so I have 45 pills sitting here unused & want my SANDOZ back!)      "

column1: 20$Condition: Other$6/13/2015 4:50:26 PM$Reviewer: Ayashi
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"Extremely water-soluble
column3: dissolves like it's held together by air and kicks in VERY quickly (I think the RoA is due to how 'crumbly' it is?) I've been on various stimulants for close to 7 years: Adderall 10mg
column9: and of course the generics of those listed that exist.  I would say Evekeo is closest to Desoxyn in terms of how it effects me.  Fast onset
column13: appetite of course is suppressed so stay hydrated on this stuff.

column1: I had a ""free"" coupon that turned out
column2: thanks to fine print
column3: to cost a 30 dollar co-pay.  Apparently it's quite expensive without it
column4: so I will be going back to Dexedrine 5mg once this two month supply is up.

column1: I cannot say it has the euphoria Desoxyn can provide when taken in higher doses
column2: but where it differs from everything I listed above
column3: it works wonders for getting out of bed.  Vyvanse takes up to an hour to kick in
column4: and Desoxyn/Dexedrine/Adderall was simply not strong enough or not the right 'type' of stimulant to actually propel me out of bed.  That said
column5: I work 12 hour days so when it comes to taking it when Vyvanse wears off it's subtle but has a nice peak that makes my 1.5 hour commute far safer
column6: and it wears off just a few hours after I get home.

column1: If the cost wasn't so ridiculous I'd go for this stuff
column2: but big pharma can stuff it because consumers are forced to use generics unless they are stupid
column3: rich
column5: probably the best IR stim out there."

column1: 22$Condition: Other$3/25/2015 12:12:51 PM$Reviewer:  on Treatment for less than 1 month$5$4$5$Been on it for two days and it works fast. Almost too fast. It doesn't last very long only about four hours at most. Best if taken twice a day
column2: Unlike the Adderall XR
column3: but close to Dexedrine it the management of ADHD. I feel like I can slow down and get my thoughts under control. Also when taken right It doesn't effect sleep. In fact over the last two days I think it helps with getting into a sleep wake pattern.
